title.rendered: With Eyelash Extensions, Training Makes All the Difference in the World

content.rendered:
If you’ve been seriously contemplating eyelash extensions and are finally ready to take the plunge into the world of perfect lashes, there’s one thing you need to know: lash training matters! The best extension applications don’t happen by accident, after all. To maximize your beauty enhancement and give your lashes the best look possible, you need to ensure that you have the right lash artist to do the job. And when it comes to lash extensions, nothing is more important than training.

At first glance, that might seem obvious. After all, it makes sense that this delicate beauty enhancement technique would have to be taught, right? Still, it’s important to understand why this training is so vital, and what it means for your overall safety, satisfaction, and lash extension results. Properly trained lash extension artists are taught to:

  • Accurately assess your lash needs. Proper training enables a lash technician to determine your lash strength, which extensions will work best for your natural lashes, and the design needed to achieve your beauty goals. They’re also adept at determining whether you have any sensitivity issues that might make lash extension a less desirable option for you.

  • Properly handle the adhesive used to secure your extensions to your natural lashes. A small percentage of people have serious sensitivities to the glue used in lash extension applications. But regardless of whether any potential sensitivity is present, the lash artist still needs to keep the adhesive away from the eye and skin. That careful attention to detail only comes from training and experience over time.

  • Deftly attach each extension to a single lash, to create just the look you desire. Your eyelashes are delicate hairs that need to be treated with the utmost care. A trained lash technician can meticulously affix each extension to your lashes, one by one, to provide the added length, curl, and thickness that you want.

  • Communicate aftercare instructions and other important information to clients. Your lash experience doesn’t end at the salon. To get the most out of your new look, you will need to know how to properly care for the extensions each day. Your technician has the training and experience you need to learn how to care for those new extensions, including details about proper aftercare in that critical 24-hour period right after your appointment.

Before you go to your first – or next – lash extension appointment, take a moment to consider the training that goes into preparing any qualified lash extension artist. Add to that the licensing requirements that most states impose upon lash extension applications, and one thing should become clear right away: there’s a lot of work that goes into creating an excellent lash technician. That should give you even greater confidence in the extension application process and provide you with the peace of mind you need to try perfect lashes for yourself. In the end, training really does make all the difference in the world!
